intro: Wikstroemia indica var. insularis, commonly known as the Island Wikstroemia, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the Thymelaeaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered white or yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, with narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy or rocky soils, making it a resilient species in tropical environments. Its ornamental value has led to its cultivation in some regions for landscaping purposes.
